poem:
"Fragments of Diplomacy"

Amidst the crackled newsprint,  
a meeting of men—  
diplomatic shadows  
casting long and brief  
on the Kremlin walls.  
A general, a ghost now,  
whispers of dust,  
while the world listens  
for the whispered peace.  
Can words resolve  
what explosions fracture?  
Days pass,  
cautiously tilting,  
toward an uncertain dawn.
